text:
Created attachment 21834
stdout and stderr of the test run

Hello!

The self-tests bundled with websh-3.6.0b4 report several failures and segmentation faults, when the software is built against Tcl-8.5.2 (Apache-2.2.8).

When using Tcl-8.4.18 (and the same Apache), all of the tests pass fine.

The test log is attached.
creator: mi+apache@aldan.algebra.com
ronnie.brunner@netcetera.ch
text:
I fixed lots of issues in the HEAD of Websh. 

Can you tell me if your tests also fail when checking against the HEAD in Subversion?

creator: ronnie.brunner@netcetera.ch
text:
I did have some errors related to Tcl8.5.2 and later. Some seem to have been related to some Tcl "problem" regarding memory handling and memory checks.

My test suite (make test as well as make apachetest) now runs w/o problems on Tcl8.5.7

Can you try with the latest version? I will close the bug if I don't hear anything within the next couple of weeks. (it has beein lying around for long enough ;-)

creator: ronnie.brunner@netcetera.ch
text: No info arrived, cannot be reproduced anymore -> INVALID

creator: mi+apache@aldan.algebra.com
text:
I don't think, asking me to "check the latest version" without RELEASING the latest version was fair.

Now that the 3.6.0b5 is available, I'll try to beat it up, but Tcl-8.5.2 is not relevant any more...

creator: ronnie.brunner@netcetera.ch
text:
Yeah, sorry. What I meant was: check with the latest version from HEAD in the repository...

But now, it is released and I'll happily reopen the bug if it still fails with a recent Tcl8.5 version :-)
